title: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (July 2021-July 2023) regarding "Citywide Nuisance Abatement Program (CNAP)" and nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as “program” and "ordinance" respectively, in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as “CNAP” and "Narcotics, Violent Crime, Unlawful Weapon or Ammunition Crime, and Gang-Related Crime Eviction Program" as described in the Los Angeles Code of Ordinances Sec. 47.50.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program and Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program and ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance or program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance and program

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the program and ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since July 2021 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

title: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (July 2021-July 2023) regarding the neighborhood nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Neighborhood Nuisances--Abatement" as described in Baltimore's city code subtitle 43A. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program and ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the  ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since July 2021 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Vacancies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of current vacancies for all departments within the State of Maine, Location of Vacant Positions, along with when the position became vacant/last time position was filled ( may be called: Vacant Position Legislative Count / FTE Count)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Corey Bouchard

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: EOG Deputy Chief
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All written communications between Katie Strickland and Sketch Piers between 1/1/2021 and the present.

All documents relevant to the hiring of Sketch Piers in his current capacity, including the qualifications of any other candidates considered, as well as any record of Piers' previous job performance during his tenure with the State of Florida. 

All allegations of misconduct, determinations of misconduct, investigations, communications or inquiries, either resolved or pending (to the extent they are public record pursuant to FL. Stat. Ch. 119)  which reference Katie Strickland. 

The travel requests, approvals, calendars, and all documents pertaining to official state travel including food and lodging expenses of both Katie Strickland and Sketch Piers from the dates 1/1/2021 to the present, including prospective travel that has not occurred but has generated responsive documents as of the date of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lauren Grummond

title: Contractor Services for Automated Traffic Enforcement FOIA - Newberg, OR

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Evaluation scores/notes related to ALL proposers, Submitted responses of ALL proposers (except Verra Mobility), and Debrief documents related to ALL proposers regarding the Contractor services for Automated Traffic Enforcement. This would have been awarded 8/8/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kory Saulnier
